is a ski resort town in

The nearest major airport is the international airport in Grenoble, located about 1h30 away by car and serviced by a number of no-frills and charter carriers. The larger International airport of Lyon St Exupéry is a little further at 2 hrs away.
The European high-speed train, the TGV, can also take you from most major cities in Europe to its terminal in Lyon or Grenoble.
There are regular shuttle buses from Lyon St Exupéry airport.
The only official transport is the ski buses which travel all around the resort regularly, and are completly free, there is also a connecting bus to alpe d'huez.

Ski! Les Deux Alpes is a great ski area with a variety of pistes suitable for all levels of skier. There is also the snow park with boxes, rails, jumps, half pipe and chill out zone which has something for the beginner to the expert rider.

Fortunately, considering our warming climate, Les Deux Alpes has a glacier which means that even in summer, there is skiing available. This also means that towards the end of the winter season, when many resorts are suffering the dreaded slushy pistes, there is still world class skiing to be had in LDA.

As well as skiing, there is hiking, swimming, ice skating available during the winter months as well as mountain biking, VTT tracks, hiking, walking during the summer.
